title: of the Schedule to the Social Welfare (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2024 (No.
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated 
Claims, Payments and Control) (Amendment)(No. 12) (Prescribed Time for 
Making Claim) Regulations 2024. 

(2) These Regulations and the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2024 shall be construed together as 
one and may be cited together as the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2024. 

Interpretation

title: of the Schedule to the Social Welfare (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2024 (No.
heading: In these Regulations–
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations– 

“Principal Regulations” means the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 (S.I. No. 142 of 2007); 

“Regulations of 2019” means the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) (Amendment) (No. 12) (Parent’s Benefit) Regulations 
2019 (S.I. No. 554 of 2019). 

Commencement

title: of the Schedule to the Social Welfare (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2024 (No.
heading: 4. Article 182 of the Principal Regulations (amended by article 7 of the
text_raw:
4. Article 182 of the Principal Regulations (amended by article 7 of the 
Regulations of 2019) is amended by the substitution of the following paragraphs 
for paragraph (a): 

“(a) in the case of State pension (contributory), the period commencing 6 months 
before and ending 3 months after the date on which, apart from satisfying the 
condition of making a claim, the claimant becomes entitled thereto, 

(ab) in the case of State pension (transition) and invalidity pension, the period 
commencing 3 months before and ending 3 months after the date on which, apart 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 1st November, 2024.

thereto,”.

HEATHER HUMPHREYS,

title: of the Schedule to the Social Welfare (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2024 (No.
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

Currently, article 182 of the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, Payments and 
Control) Regulations 2007, provides that the prescribed time for making a claim 
for State Pension (Contributory) is within the period of 3 months before and 3 
months after that person becomes entitled to State Pension (Contributory). 

Failure to make a claim for State Pension (Contributory) within the prescribed 
time means that section 241(2) of the Social Welfare Act 2007 applies. This 
provides that where a person fails to claim within the time prescribed, that person 
will not be paid in respect of any period more than 6 months before the claim is 
made. 

These Regulations amend the prescribed time for making a claim for State 
Pension (Contributory) so that a claim may be made up to 6 months before the 
date the person becomes entitled to State Pension (Contributory). 

From end October 2024, an online application form for state pension 
(contributory) and state pension (non-contributory) will be available to 
claimants. To align state pension (contributory) application timelines with the 
state pension (non-contributory), it is necessary to increase the prescribed time 
for state pension (contributory) from 3 to 6 months. 

The prescribed period after which a person becomes entitled to State Pension 
(Contributory) in which to make a claim remains at 3 months. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [584] 5
